captions.text: -Hey guys!

-It's Brooklyn and Bailey, and
Valentine's Day is so close.
We're super, super excited.

So today we decided to do
a Valentines fashion video

so you guys can look
your best on Valentine's

Day for your friends,
or family, or maybe even
some of your lovers.
So here you guys go.

-To start off my super
cute Valentine's outfit,

I have these brown wedges that
are in our thrift store fashion

video, and I also wearing
these cream ruffled socks
from Top Shop.

Next up, I have my
skirt from Forever 21,
it's just cream and ruffled.

And to go on top of it, I have
my pink sweater with these

elbow heart-- I don't know
what you would call them--
-Patches.
-Elbow patches?
There we go.
Heart patches.

And it's so cute, and it brings
in the Valentine's theme.

I'm also wearing a light pink
belt to go with my sweater,

and a necklace that
says love, to bring
into the Valentine's theme.

And then my hair's just
pulled up into a fish tail,

loosened up to make it all
super cute and lovey-dovey.

-To start off I'm
just going to start

with my pink and
white polka dot shirt,

this quarter length
sleeve shirt.
And I got it from Papaya.

And this silver heart
necklace, with hearts

at the bottom of it, that
I got from Aeropostale,

and this cute lace
braid, which you

can find the tutorial for
at cutegirlshairstyles.

This black skirt was
also from Papaya,

and it kind of has these like,
suspenders that connect it,
I don't know.

And these black knockoff
Converse are from Aeropostale.

And this whole outfit just
makes the complete, perfect,
Valentine's outfit.
-Hey all you love birds!

For my second
Valentine's outfit,

I'm going to start
with my boots, which

are these black knockoff Doc
Martin's from Aeropostale.

I'm also wearing
these black, white,
and grey leggings obviously.

And they have these cute
leather strips down the middle.

Next I have my white sweater
that we got from Papaya again.

It has this cute
heart that says,

"Always and forever"
and these cute

slits on the shoulders,
just to add a girly look.

I am wearing a light pink
beanie from Aeropostale,

and then I also pulled my hair
into two loose side pig-tails,

for a cute, altogether,
Valentine's look.

This outfit is for all of you
less dressy girls out there,
I'm with you.

I get the feeling, I just
don't like wearing skirts.

So I'm wearing this cute
outfit-- Let me set down

my love really
quick-- I'm wearing

this cute outfit, the shirt
that says "Love is everything"

from Papaya, and these ripped
jeans from Aeropostale.

And my-- yeah, my
shirt has a tail.
These jeans from Aeropostale.

My shoes are white Converse,
and you can get those

at any local mall or
anything, you know?

I have my arm candy, and
my ring that says love.

And my hair is in a
messy bun, and I just

have this cute red bandana
tied in a little knot.

-Thank you guys so
much for watching.

-Be sure to leave a comment
below on which outfit

you think you would
wear on Valentine's Day,

and we will see
you guys next week.
-Bye!
See ya!

-Well you're not supposed
to laugh, you always laugh.
It's so hard.
Okay.
Wait, I can't look at you.

title: Valentine's Day Fashion Lookbook | Brooklyn and Bailey
